title: 820-3332 Green light no start
message:
Im working on a 820-3332 and cant really understand whats going on.

With keyboard attached its starts up, but no green light and fans going full speed. Cant find ssd but boots into efi and pass.

Without keyboard I get green light but no fan spin 


Measurements without keyboard

PPBUS_G3H 12.3v


PP5V_S5 5v

PP5V_S4 0v


PP3V3_S5 3.3v

PP3V3_S4 0.140v

P3v3s3_s4 3.3v

title: 820-3332 Green light no start
message:
"PPBUS_G3H 12.3v"
Incorrect communication between SMC and ISL6259.

Test the board alone, no battery, no keyboard, nor other accessories.
It should start automatically with original 85W charger.
If not, post PPBUS_G3H, SMC_ADAPTER_EN, PM_BATLOW_L, S5_PWRGD, PM_DSW_PWRGD, PCH_DSWVRMEN, PM_SLP_SUS_L, 3V3_SUS.

title: 820-3332 Green light no start
message:
Measurements earlier was with board alone,
PPBUS_G3H    12.3v
SMC_ADAPTER_EN   3.3v
PM_BATLOW_L   0v
S5_PWRGD   3.3v
PM_DSW_PWRGD   3.3v
PCH_DSWVRMEN   3.22v
PM_SLP_SUS_L   3.3v
3V3_SUS   0v

title: 820-3332 Green light no start
message:
"do you mean short r5016 to ground?"
Or R5015, which one you want.
In fact, solder a tiny wire to SMC_ONOFF_L and momentary touch the ground with it.
Did you start it on charger only, or battery connected too?
Do the tests without battery.
Try to start in SMC bypass, if doesn't start in normal way.

Also check AVREF_SMC voltage.

Try changing U7940.

title: 820-3332 Green light no start
message:
You can't get PM_SUS_EN when SMC_BATLOW_L is low.
If you got it few times, be sure that SMC_BATLOW_L was high then; and PM_SLP_SUS_L too.
So find why one of these signals is not steady.

title: 820-3332 Green light no start
message: will SMC_BATLOW_L be high even without battery connected?

title: 820-3332 Green light no start

Must be high with correct charger connected.
If not, should be SMC issue...

title: 820-3332 Green light no start
message: Now I have replaced the SMC again but still the same. No SMC_BATLOW_L :( Seems I cant figure this out. Fan pulsing and no start. Not charging. Starts in SMC bypass mode but not booting cant see SSD. Is there anything else that can cause SMC_BATLOW_L not getting high?

title: 820-3332 Green light no start
message: Try known good 85W charger.

title: 820-3332 Green light no start
message: already tested with that. Can it need the battery to be connected? or something else can be wrong?

title: 820-3332 Green light no start
message:
SMC_BATLOW_L is not related with the main battery.
Apple kept BATLOW name from Intel documentation for PCH.
Intel specification relates it with battery level.

"[SIZE=12px][B]BATLOW# [/B](Mobile Only)
[B]Battery Low:[/B] An input from the battery to indicate that there is insufficient power to boot the system. Assertion will prevent wake from S3-S5 state. This signal can also be enabled to cause an SMI# when asserted."

But SMC generates it in base of charger recognition.
No matter battery is present, or not, its value doesn't vary.
Only charger presence, or incorrect power model than expected, will change its level.[/SIZE]

title: 820-3332 Green light no start

title: 820-3332 Green light no start
message:
PSU with 85W cable should be good enough.
But connect it carefully, or turn on the PSU after cable is connected.

Does it still start always on SMC bypass mode?
SMC_ADAPTER_EN is high?
Did you change DCIN board?
Be sure to have the plastic foil around power connector.
